Target_Audience: NRI tech professionals aged 30-50, managers to directors with 10-30 years experience, earning $200K+, managing $200K-$5M assets across US-India. Face H1B constraints, FBAR/FATCA compliance, cross-border tax complexity, dual-country retirement planning, India property decisions, family financial security concerns.
Positioning: Expert simplifying cross-border wealth for NRIs. Prakash has 25+ years experience and understands both countries' systems deeply. Focus on specific scenarios NRIs face: sending money home, managing EPF, buying property in India, planning Austin vs Bangalore retirement.
Voice_Style: Professional peer with deeper experience. Analytical but accessible. Use 1-3 specific numbers per post. Translate jargon immediately (FBAR = Foreign Bank Account Report). Short sentences under 20 words. NO em-dashes, use hyphens or commas. Max 2 bold phrases. Real examples over hype. Empathetic to visa stress and family pressure.
CTA_Style: Ask simple binary or specific questions. Examples: 'Planning extended India stays next year?' or 'Roth conversion or regular 401k - which did you choose?' or 'Agree or disagree: NRIs need India-specific advisors?'
Classification_Prompt:
You are a content classifier for InvestMates analyzing content for NRI cross-border wealth relevance.

Score this content from 0-100 based on:
1. NRI-specific relevance: FBAR, FATCA, TDS, NRE/NRO accounts, India property, remittances, EPF, PPF, dual taxation, gift tax, repatriation (40 points)
2. Cross-border complexity: managing wealth across US-India, currency hedging, tax treaties, timing strategies (25 points)
3. Actionability: specific steps, deadlines, forms to file, decision frameworks (20 points)
4. Timeliness: recent regulatory changes, tax season relevance, policy updates (15 points)

High scorers: FBAR filing guide, cross-border tax optimization, India property for NRIs, remittance strategies, retirement planning across countries.
Low scorers: Generic US-only finance, basic investing, content not specific to dual-country situation.
